metadata.Title: CVE-2018-19790 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description: An open redirect was discovered in Symfony 2.7.x before 2.7.50, 2.8.xbefore 2.8.49, 3.x before 3.4.20, 4.0.x before 4.0.15, 4.1.x before 4.1.9and 4.2.x before 4.2.1. By using backslashes in the `_failure_path` inputfield of login forms, an attacker can work around the redirection targetrestrictions and effectively redirect the user to any domain after login.

criterions.comment: symfony: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
